대사: (The ⓑ(hospital)ⓦ is full of patients.)
(Most patients are waiting their turn with hollow eyes.)
(Her busy-looking name tag reads 'Kate Lizzie'.)
@Hi^ I know you're busy^ but can I ask you a question?@
@Sure! It's fine for a moment. If the doctors catch me slacking off^ I'll get in trouble.@
@Maybe there's a lot of people around these days?@
@That's right^ ⓡ(insomnia)ⓦ seems to be prevalent recently. As you can see^ we're very busy during the daytime.@
@Okay. I've never heard of an ⓡ(insomnia)ⓦ epidemic. Has this happened before?@
@No^ I think it's been about a month ago that we've gotten so many patients.@
@I don't know the details either. It would be best to ask the doctors for accurate information.@
@We're busy during the day^ so it's best to come in the morning or afternoon.@
(At that point^ I heard a voice inside calling for Kate.)
@Yes~ I'll be right there~@
@Then I'll see you later!@◎⑦
(A very busy-looking doctor is flipping through the chart.)
(He said^ without even looking at me.)
@I'm sorry^ but I'm busy right now.@
@Come back later.@
(And then he's still looking at the chart.)
(He's busy^ just grimaces and doesn't react.)
@Hi^ I know you're busy^ but can I ask you a question?@
@Yeah^ that's fine for now^ I'm pretty much done for the day.@
((The names are scrawled across the chart she's holding.)
@Maybe there's a lot of people around these days?@
@Yeah^ we've been having a bit of an ⓡ(insomnia)ⓦ epidemic lately^ so we're very busy during the day.@
@I see. I've never heard of an ⓡ(insomnia)ⓦ epidemic before. Has this happened before?@
@No^ I think it's been about a month ago or so that we've gotten this many patients.@
@I don't know the details either^ but it would be best to ask the doctors for accurate information.@☆①
@Do you have any more questions~?@☆①
(Her name tag says 'Kate Lizzie.')
@It's giving me a headache these days~.@
@ⓡ(Insomnia)ⓦ.... Do you know the cause yet?@
@I'm not sure^ but it seems like it would be best to ask the doctors for advice. @
@Didn't you hear anything about ⓡ(nightmares)ⓦ?@
@I've heard that a lot lately^ with a lot of ⓡ(insomniacs)ⓦ mentioning ⓡ(nightmares)ⓦ.@
@That's weird^ an ⓡ(insomniac)ⓦ with contagious ⓡ(nightmares)ⓦ.@
@Really. It's my first time hearing this while working here.@
@Is there anything special about ⓡ(paranoia)ⓦ?@
@Hmm... I can't think of one^ so you'll have to ask the doctors!@
@Is there anything special going on at the ⓑ(hospital)ⓦ?@
@It's pretty much business as usual^ except for the influx of patients during the day.@
@Ah^ I've seen a little less of the usual "dangerous-looking" patients lately.@
@Have you noticed a characteristic ⓡ(fishy smell)ⓦ in your city lately that you don't normally smell?@
@ⓡ(Fishy smell)ⓦ? I don't think I've ever smelled that in a ⓑ(hospital)ⓦ.@
@Hmm...~ I'm not sure about that.@
@Hello^ can I speak to you for a moment?@
@Of course. What brings you here?@☆①
@Do you have any more questions.@☆①
(He is smoking a cigarette with an expressionless face.)
(The name tag says Alan P. Parks.)
@You haven't heard about the contents of the ⓡ(nightmare)ⓦ?@
@The vast majority of patients are extremely reluctant to discuss their ⓡ(nightmares)ⓦ directly.@
@Still^ overall^ the majority of ⓡ(nightmares)ⓦ seem to involve water or the ocean.@
@Maybe it's a form of rabies^ but it hasn't been reported.@
@That's what the patient said? ...and that gives us another example.@
@Other patients are also mentioning a lot of ⓡ(●4ⓝnightmares)ⓦ involving water^ especially the ocean.@
@Why this is happening is a question.@
@Ohhh... Were you also trained in medicine? It's a complicated issue.@
@But I'm thinking in the same direction. I'm looking at the ⓡ(nightmare)ⓦ as a direct cause.@
@I heard there's an epidemic of ⓡ(insomnia)ⓦ lately^ is that true?@
@Yes. We're seeing more than we ever have before. It's baffling to us^ too.@
@So what about the symptoms themselves^ compared to before.@
@Clearly^ this ⓡ(insomnia)ⓦ is unprecedented and unique.@
@First of all^ it hasn't happened anywhere else outside of Arkham. It's like an endemic disease^ and it's centered here.@
@On top of that^ the symptoms are unique. except medication side effects^ ⓡ(insomnia)ⓦ is usually caused by stress or anxiety.@
@But in the case of the ⓡ(insomnia)ⓦ we're seeing in Arkham^ it's because patients are afraid to sleep.@
@I wouldn't actually call it ⓡ(●2ⓘinsomnia)ⓦ^ more like a sleep phobia or aversion.@
@They are afraid of sleeping?@
@Yes^ and I strongly suspect a ⓡ(nightmare)ⓦ as the cause of that fear.@
@That's one of the things that most of our patients are complaining about.@
@You're saying that  ⓡ(insomnia)ⓦ is caused by fear of sleeping and that ⓡ(nightmares)ⓦ are a direct cause of that.@
@That's right^ I haven't heard of such a disease^ but...@
@Maybe it's an Arkham endemic^ like I said^ or maybe it's just mass hysteria.@
@I see...@
'This is more serious than I thought^ I thought it was just a tropical night thing.'
'Based on what we're hearing now^ it sounds like a lot of people at Arkham are in a similar situation to ⓖ(Aiden)ⓦ.'
@Is there anything special about ⓡ(paranoia)ⓦ?@
@This ⓡ(●2ⓞparanoia)ⓦ seems to be driven by extreme sleep deprivation and fear^ and the ⓡ(nightmares)ⓦ that they see when sleep.@
@In other words^ if the ⓡ(insomnia)ⓦ is solved^ the rest of the problems will take care of themselves.@
@Do you remember ⓖ(Mr. Aiden Triss)ⓦ^ I heard that he was a patient at your hospital and was examined.@
@ⓖ(●2ⓐMr. Aiden Triss)ⓦ... ah^ I remember him.@
@How does it compare to others?@
@We're not allowed to disclose patient information... but the symptoms are similar to the ⓡ(insomnia)ⓦ that's going around Arkham right now.@
@That's all I can say about that.@
@Well... I don't think I have anything to add.@
